beer.beer_description: Based on a German Kristallweizen style beer, but in a nod to its origins, Moa Blanc is brewed using renowned Sauvignon Blanc wine yeast.  A blend of 50% wheat malt and 50% barley malt results in an elegantly smooth beer with hints of spice and uplifting esters.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 240 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 49!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 300 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 61!

If your mash uses more than 50% wheat, you’ve got yourself a wheat beer. This diverse family includes goses, hefeweizens, American wheat ales, and more! That's 75 different beers in the "Wheat" category! Try 5 more for Level 16!

items.badge_description: Kiwis, rugby and sheep aren’t the only things New Zealand has to offer. There’s a ton of great beers in a variety of styles just waiting for you to explore! That's 15 different beers from a brewery in New Zealand. Try 5 more for Level 4.

items.badge_description: Hazy and white like a winter storm, but best enjoyed on a warm sunny day. This specific style of wheat beer brings with it a subtle mix of spices and hops, giving it a distinct flavor with little bitterness. That's 20 different beers categorized as a Witbier. Try 5 more for Level 5!

user.bio: Sydney based craft beer lover. Worked in craft beer for 7 years.
